trans-unit.source: How to configure an availability set for virtual machines
trans-unit.target: How to configure an availability set for virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Gives the steps to configure an availability set for a new or existing virtual machine in Azure using the Azure portal and Azure PowerShell commands
trans-unit.target: Gives the steps to configure an availability set for a new or existing virtual machine in Azure using the Azure portal and Azure PowerShell commands

trans-unit.source: How to configure an availability set for virtual machines
trans-unit.target: How to configure an availability set for virtual machines

trans-unit.source: An availability set helps keep your virtual machines available during downtime, such as during maintenance.
trans-unit.target: An availability set helps keep your virtual machines available during downtime, such as during maintenance.

trans-unit.source: Placing two or more similarly configured virtual machines in an availability set creates the redundancy needed to maintain availability of the applications or services that your virtual machine runs.
trans-unit.target: Placing two or more similarly configured virtual machines in an availability set creates the redundancy needed to maintain availability of the applications or services that your virtual machine runs.

trans-unit.source: For details about how this works, see <link><linkText>Manage the availability of virtual machines[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details about how this works, see <link><linkText>Manage the availability of virtual machines[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It's a best practice to use both availability sets and load-balancing endpoints to help ensure that your application is always available and running efficiently.
trans-unit.target: It's a best practice to use both availability sets and load-balancing endpoints to help ensure that your application is always available and running efficiently.

trans-unit.source: For details about load-balanced endpoints, see <link><linkText>Load balancing for Azure infrastructure services[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details about load-balanced endpoints, see <link><linkText>Load balancing for Azure infrastructure services[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can put virtual machines into an availability set by using one of two options:
trans-unit.target: You can put virtual machines into an availability set by using one of two options:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Option 1: Create a virtual machine and an availability set at the same time[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Option 1: Create a virtual machine and an availability set at the same time[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Then, add new virtual machines to the set when you create those virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Then, add new virtual machines to the set when you create those virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Option 2: Add an existing virtual machine to an availability set[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Option 2: Add an existing virtual machine to an availability set[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines that you want to put in the same availability set must belong to the same cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines that you want to put in the same availability set must belong to the same cloud service.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Option 1: Create a virtual machine and an availability set at the same time
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Option 1: Create a virtual machine and an availability set at the same time

trans-unit.source: You can use either the Azure portal or Azure PowerShell commands to do this.
trans-unit.target: You can use either the Azure portal or Azure PowerShell commands to do this.

trans-unit.source: To use the portal:
trans-unit.target: To use the portal:

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the <link><linkText>portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, sign in to the <link><linkText>portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click New.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click New.

trans-unit.source: Click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.
trans-unit.target: Click Virtual Machine, and then click From Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Use the first two screens to select an image, a user name and password, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Use the first two screens to select an image, a user name and password, and so on.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>Create a virtual machine running Windows[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>Create a virtual machine running Windows[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the third screen, you can configure resources for networking, storage, and availability.
trans-unit.target: In the third screen, you can configure resources for networking, storage, and availability.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: Choose the appropriate cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Choose the appropriate cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Leave it set to Create a new cloud service (unless you are adding this new virtual machine to an existing virtual machine cloud service).
trans-unit.target: Leave it set to Create a new cloud service (unless you are adding this new virtual machine to an existing virtual machine cloud service).

trans-unit.source: Then, under Cloud Service DNS Name, type a name.
trans-unit.target: Then, under Cloud Service DNS Name, type a name.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name becomes part of the URI that's used to contact the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The DNS name becomes part of the URI that's used to contact the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The cloud service acts as a communications and isolation group.
trans-unit.target: The cloud service acts as a communications and isolation group.

trans-unit.source: All virtual machines in the same cloud service can communicate with each other, can be set up for load balancing, and can be placed in the same availability set.
trans-unit.target: All virtual machines in the same cloud service can communicate with each other, can be set up for load balancing, and can be placed in the same availability set.

trans-unit.source: Under Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network, specify a virtual network if you plan to use one.
trans-unit.target: Under Region/Affinity Group/Virtual Network, specify a virtual network if you plan to use one.

trans-unit.source: Important: If you want a virtual machine to use a virtual network, you must join the virtual machine to the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Important: If you want a virtual machine to use a virtual network, you must join the virtual machine to the virtual network when you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can't join the virtual machine to a virtual network after you create the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You can't join the virtual machine to a virtual network after you create the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Virtual Network Overview[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Virtual Network Overview[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Create the availability set.
trans-unit.target: Create the availability set.

trans-unit.source: Under Availability Set, leave it set to Create an availability set.
trans-unit.target: Under Availability Set, leave it set to Create an availability set.

trans-unit.source: Then, type a name for the set.
trans-unit.target: Then, type a name for the set.

trans-unit.source: Create the default endpoints and add more endpoints if needed.
trans-unit.target: Create the default endpoints and add more endpoints if needed.

trans-unit.source: You also can add endpoints later.
trans-unit.target: You also can add endpoints later.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create an availability set for a new virtual machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create an availability set for a new virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the fourth screen, click the extensions that you want to install.
trans-unit.target: On the fourth screen, click the extensions that you want to install.

trans-unit.source: Extensions provide features that make it easier to manage the virtual machine, such as running antimalware or resetting passwords.
trans-unit.target: Extensions provide features that make it easier to manage the virtual machine, such as running antimalware or resetting passwords.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure VM Agent and VM Extensions</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure VM Agent and VM Extensions</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow to create the virtual machine and the availability set.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow to create the virtual machine and the availability set.

trans-unit.source: From the dashboard of the new virtual machine, you can click Configure to see that the virtual machine belongs to the new availability set.
trans-unit.target: From the dashboard of the new virtual machine, you can click Configure to see that the virtual machine belongs to the new availability set.

trans-unit.source: To use Azure PowerShell commands to create an Azure virtual machine and add it to a new or existing availability set, see the following:
trans-unit.target: To use Azure PowerShell commands to create an Azure virtual machine and add it to a new or existing availability set, see the following:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Windows-based virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Linux-based virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Use Azure PowerShell to create and preconfigure Linux-based virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Option 2: Add an existing virtual machine to an availability set
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Option 2: Add an existing virtual machine to an availability set

trans-unit.source: In the portal, you can add existing virtual machines to an existing availability set
trans-unit.target: In the portal, you can add existing virtual machines to an existing availability set

trans-unit.source: or create a new one for them.
trans-unit.target: or create a new one for them.

trans-unit.source: (Keep in mind that the virtual machines in the same availability set must belong to the same cloud service.)
trans-unit.target: (Keep in mind that the virtual machines in the same availability set must belong to the same cloud service.)

trans-unit.source: The steps are almost the same.
trans-unit.target: The steps are almost the same.

trans-unit.source: With Azure PowerShell, you can add the virtual machine to an existing availability set.
trans-unit.target: With Azure PowerShell, you can add the virtual machine to an existing availability set.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already done so, sign in to the <link><linkText>portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already done so, sign in to the <link><linkText>portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: From the list of virtual machines, select the name of the virtual machines that you want to add to the set.
trans-unit.target: From the list of virtual machines, select the name of the virtual machines that you want to add to the set.

trans-unit.source: From the tabs below the virtual machine name, click Configure.
trans-unit.target: From the tabs below the virtual machine name, click Configure.

trans-unit.source: In the Settings section, find Availability Set.
trans-unit.target: In the Settings section, find Availability Set.

trans-unit.source: Do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: A.
trans-unit.target: A.

trans-unit.source: Select Create an availability set, and then type a name for the set.
trans-unit.target: Select Create an availability set, and then type a name for the set.

trans-unit.source: B.
trans-unit.target: B.

trans-unit.source: Select Select an availability set, and then select a set from the list.
trans-unit.target: Select Select an availability set, and then select a set from the list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create an availability set for an existing virtual machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create an availability set for an existing virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: To use Azure PowerShell commands, open an administrator-level Azure PowerShell session and run the following command. For the placeholders (such as <VmCloudServiceName>), replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct names.
trans-unit.target: To use Azure PowerShell commands, open an administrator-level Azure PowerShell session and run the following command. For the placeholders (such as <VmCloudServiceName>), replace everything within the quotes, including the < and > characters, with the correct names.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine might have to be restarted to finish adding it to the availability set.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine might have to be restarted to finish adding it to the availability set.

trans-unit.source: Additional resources
trans-unit.target: Additional resources

trans-unit.source: [About Azure virtual machine configuration settings]
trans-unit.target: [About Azure virtual machine configuration settings]
